message_1: Suppose you have a ciphertext "IXLILIRK" that was encrypted using a Caesar cipher with a key of 17. What is the plaintext message?
message_2:
To decrypt the ciphertext "IXLILIRK" using a Caesar cipher with a key of 17, we need to shift each letter back by 17 positions in the alphabet.

Here's the decryption process for each letter:

I -> (I - 17) -> B
X -> (X - 17) -> I
L -> (L - 17) -> Y
I -> (I - 17) -> B
L -> (L - 17) -> Y
I -> (I - 17) -> B
R -> (R - 17) -> E
K -> (K - 17) -> V

So, the plaintext message is "BIYBYBEV".
